definition: A reign is the period of a person's or dynasty's occupation of the office of monarch of a nation , of a people or of a spiritual community . In most hereditary monarchies and some elective monarchies there have been no limits on the duration of a sovereign's reign or incumbency, nor is there a term of office. Thus, a reign usually lasts until the monarch dies, unless the monarchy itself is abolished or the monarch abdicates or is deposed. In elective monarchies, there may be a fixed period of time for the duration of the monarch's tenure in office . The term of a reign can be indicated with the abbreviation "r." after a sovereign's name, such as the following: George VI, King of Great Britain, Ireland and the British Dominions, Emperor of India
description: period in which a sovereign rules

definition: the period during which a monarch is sovereign
the period of rule of a monarch.

In religion, a precursor , also known as forerunner , predecessor , harbinger or herald , is a holy person who announced the approaching appearance of a central figure of the religion or who identified a central figure of the religion during the latterâ€™s childhood
description: holy person who announced the approaching appearance of a prophet

definition: one who precedes you in time (as in holding a position or office)
a person who held a job or office before the current holder.
Khalifa or Khalifah is a name or title which means "successor", "ruler" or "leader"
a person who follows next in order
a person or thing that succeeds another.

A ruler , sometimes called a rule or line gauge , is a device used in geometry and technical drawing, as well as the engineering and construction industries, to measure distances or draw straight lines.
description: instrument used in geometry, technical drawing, printing, engineering and building to measure distances or to rule straight lines; straightedge which may also contain calibrated lines to measure distances

definition: a hard ferromagnetic silver-white bivalent or trivalent metallic element; a trace element in plant and animal nutrition
a person who rules or commands
